description.narrative: By 2021, communities in target areas are able and willing to use quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, disadvantaged children, adolescents, and women utilise quality health, nutrition, water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, communities in target areas are able and willing to use quality WASH services.

description.narrative: Backed by strong involvement of community hygiene promoters, community leaders and women's groups, Ministry of Health implemented the national roadmap to eliminate open defecation by 2022, enabling 208 villages (157,075 residents, including 86,391 females) to declare ODF status. In addition, the entire Nakfa sub-zoba (47,326 residents, more than 26,000 females) achieved ODF status in September. By the end of 2019, 40 per cent of Eritrea's rural residents had declared ODF status through community-led total sanitation approach, and 719 villages had been triggered with technical and logistical support from UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
